Text:
Schmitt (CAN) lead the match with 22 points (19 spikes, 2 aces).

Bruno (ARG) lead the visitors with 12 points (9 spikes, 1 block, 2 aces)
Match quotes coming shortly.  Re-match will be tomorrow night from Halifax 6:30PM local (GMT -3:00)
Canada waves in appreciation of their East coast fans after a 3-0 match win v Argentina
Schmitt heads back to serve match point 24-19 and promptly gets the ace to close out the match (25-19) for Canada
Back row spike from Argentina's Zornetta. 23-19 Canada lead
Substitution: Crer re-enters for Poglajen for Argentina
Substitution for Argentina: Poglajen enters for Crer
Subsitution for Canada: Max Burt enters for Duff.  Burt played his college volleyball at Dalhousie University in Halifax and this is his first match for Team Canada in World League play
Great one-handed set from Schneider and Verhoeff finishes with authority
Canada calls time-out.  Argentina down by 3.
Substitutions for Canada:  Sanders and Schmitt re-enter
Bruno blocks Perrin as Argentina looks to climb back in this 3rd set
Subsitutions for Canada: Sanders replaces Schneider and Perrin replaces Schmitt
2100 fans from the region in attendance at tonight's match in Halifax!
Canada coach Hoag calls time-out.  Argentina within 4 points with 16-12 lead for Canada
Argentina scores consecutive points from TTO from big block from Pablo Crer and 2 spikes from Bruno
TTO2 of the second set as Canada taking 16-9 advantage of Argentine errors
Schmitt spikes the ball with no block, tougher to defend on the 208cm Canadian
30-year-old Jose Luis Gonzalez looking to provide the spark for Argentina as he helps his team from off the bench
Pablo Crer spikes the ball in response.
Marshall spikes off the block on a long rally.  Canada leads 13-6
Can't get past the Duff.  Canada's block leads 12-6 in 3rd set.  Argentina calls time-out
Jose Luis Gonzalez spikes the ball through the seam in the block to bring ARG within 4 points
Another long rally and Van Lankvelt scores a tip off the block for Canada to lead 9-4
Jose Luis Gonzalez finds the corner to get some momentum for ARG
Ball off the antenna from Argentina, leads to TTO1 of set 3.  Canada leads 8-3
Schmitt hammers a service ace for Canada to lead 7-3
J.L. Gonzalez replaces Martina for Argentina
Verhoeff continues the blocking trend for Canada.  Canadians lead 6-3
Ramos (ARG) makes no mistake this time as he puts the Mikasa to the floor
Time-out called by ARG coach Alvarez, as CAN leads 5-2
Verhoeff denies the attack from Ramos for 4-2 CAN lead
Slick roll shot around the block from Zornetta as ARG ties the set 2-2
Also, Schneider replaces Sanders in the 3rd set for Canada
Zornetta again spikes off the block of Schmitt for 1-0 ARG lead
Same line-up for Argentina heading to the 3rd set
Line-up change for the 3rd set for Canada:  Van Lankvelt will be on the court replacing Perrin
Rudy Verhoeff with the roof to grab the 2nd set for Canada (27-25).
Side-out after side-out here at the Scotiabank Centre.  Schmitt at the service line 25-24
Substitution for Canada:  Fred Winters replaces Justin Duff and heads back to serve 24-23
All tied at 23-23
Substitution for Canada:  Schneider replaces Sanders for back row setting duties
Coach Alvarez calls a timeout for Argentina as Canada takes 22-20 lead
What a rally!  Big digs, and Schmitt wins the joust at the net for the point.  Canada takes the lead 21-20 in the 2nd set
Nicolas Bruno with strong spike down the line at Schmitt.  19-18 lead for ARG
Canadian reception ducks and covers as service goes long.  2nd set tied 17-17
Timeout from coach Hoag for Canada.  His 2nd timeout of the set.
Pablo Crer (ARG) responds with a crafty tip.  Argentina leads 17-16
Marshall (CAN) hammers the Mikasa for an uncontested point
TTO2 of the 2nd set, ARG leads 16-14
Correction:  Argentina coach for the match is Alvarez.
Toon Van Lankvelt gets the touch on the 3-man Canadian block.  Argentina calls timeout as the host team is within a point
Halifax crowd enjoys the highs and lows of this match at the Scotiabank Centre
Rudy Verhoeff spikes the ball into the open seam for a Canadian point
Net violation on Schmitt, Argentina leads 15-11 and CAN coach Hoag will call timeout.
Van Lankvelt pushes the ball off the outside of a 3-man Argentine block.  Canada down 11-13
Substitution for Canada:  Van Lankvelt will replace Perrin
Schmitt cross-court shot responds for Canada
Zornetta passes the Mikasa with his chest and Bruno scores.
Gavin Schmitt responds with a spike down the line for Canada.  ARG leads 9-5
Setter D. Gonazlez using fast offence to help lead the Argentines.
Canada served long, point for Argentina and TTO-1.  ARG leads 8-4 in 2nd set
Canadians argue a blocked ball touched the line, but point will be scored by Argentina to lead 6-3
Zornetta (ARG) at 182cm not afraid to score off the block of Gavin Schmitt (CAN) at 208cm
Back row spike from Gord Perrin (CAN) gets his team on the scoreboard for the 2nd set
Pablo Crer (ARG) scores on a quick back set from D. Gonzalez
Bruno begins the 2nd set with a service ace to lead 1-0
No changes on the Argentine side for set 2
2nd set line-up change for Canada:  Verhoeff will replace Vigrass
Canada takes the first set 25-22 to lead the match 1-0 in Halifax
Substituion for Argentina, in is Jose Luis Gonzalez and Chirivino
First play when substituted in, Van Lankvelt with our first big block of the match!  Canada at set point 24-21
Substitution - Toon Van Lankvelt in for Sanders, Schneider for Vigrass
Another spike off the Argentine block that wiggle the antenna from Gavin Schmitt (CAN)
Canadian coach Glenn Hoag calls his first time-out as Argentina within 1 in the first set.  Canada leads 21-20
Justin Duff splits the block for the point 20-19
Zornetta the left handed spiker get the point off the block for Argentina
Schmitt continues to paint the lines for Canada.  19-17 lead for the Canadians
Argentina coach Velasco calls timeout, Canada leads 18-16.
Back and forth shoot-out on the attack from both teams in Halifax 17-16 Canada leads
Canada takes their first lead in the match at TT0 #2, leading 16-15
Canada continues to climb back into the match from Schmitt, but Argentina continues to push back
Pablo Crer scores another point from the middle.  TTO ARG leads 8-7
Gord Perrin (CAN) paints the line for a service ace.  Match tied 7-7 in 1st set
Gord Perrin and Gavin Schmitt with back to back spikes to get within 2 points.  ARG leads 5-3
Gavin Schmitt (CAN) puts his team on the board, 4-1 ARG leads
Argentina with an early 4-0 lead to start the match
Pablo Crer gets our first point with a spike from the middle for ARG
First serve from Halifax from Canada's Sanders

Starting line-up for Canada:

Sanders, Perrin, Duff, Schmitt, Marshall, Vigrass, Bann (L)

Starting line-up for Argentina:

Bruno, 

González, 
Martina 
Crer 

Ramos

Zornetta

Tonight's officials for our match in Halifax between CAN v ARG

1st Official: Simone Santi (ITA)

2nd Official: Hamid Alrousi (UAE)

Both teams earned 4 points in weekend 3 of the 2015 FIVB World League.  Argentina currently holds a 1-1 record in their first weekend of action vs Cuba.  Canada is 3-1 in World League play, on top of capturing a berth at the 2015 World Cup in Japan by winning the NORCECA Champions Cup in Detroit, USA two weeks ago

Fans starting to take their seats for Canada v Argentina match at Scotiabank Centre in Halifax.

This is the first FIVB World League match in Nova Scotia.  Halifax did host the 2011 and 2012 FIVB Beach Volleyball Junior World Championships.
Tonight's jersey colours for the match: Canada will wear black with Libero in red while Argentina will wear the striped blue and white with Libero in solid navy

Tonight, FIVB World League returns to Canada.  Here are the team rosters for weekend 4:

Argentina

D. Gonzalez, M. Chirivino,J. L. González, F. Martina, P Crer, M. Ramos, F. Franetovich, L. Zornetta, N. Bruno, R. Villalba, C. Poglajen, F. Santucci

Canada
D. Schneider, TJ Sanders, B. Bann, G, Schmitt, C. Schouten, F. Winters, S. Marshall, J. DeRocco, G. Perrin, T. Van Lankvelt, M. Burt, J. Duff, G. Vigrass, R. Verhoeff,
